pesticide.PPE: coveralls over long-sleeved shirt and long pants, rubber gloves, chemical resistant footwear plus socks, and protective eyewear (goggles or face shield)

Safety_Information.general_Info: Causes irreversible eye damage and skin burns. May be fatal if absorbed through skin. Harmful if swallowed. Do not get in eyes, on skin, or on clothing. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling and before eating, drinking, chewing gum, using tobacco, or using the toilet.
Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 – 20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a POISON CONTROL CENTER or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by the POISON CONTROL CENTER or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person. Call a POISON CONTROL CENTER or doctor immediately for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth to mouth if possible. Call a POISON CONTROL CENTER or doctor immediately for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15 – 20 minutes. Call a POISON CONTROL CENTER or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Probable mucosal damage may contraindicate the use of gastric lavage.
